camel.sink.endpoint.branchName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.branchName
camel.sink.endpoint.branchName.description: The branch name to work on

camel.sink.endpoint.remoteName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.remoteName
camel.sink.endpoint.remoteName.description: The remote repository name to use in particular operation like pull

camel.sink.endpoint.tagName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.tagName
camel.sink.endpoint.tagName.description: The tag name to work on

camel.sink.endpoint.allowEmpty.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowEmpty
camel.sink.endpoint.allowEmpty.description: The flag to manage empty git commits

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to do on the repository One of: [clone] [init] [add] [remove] [commit] [commitAll] [createBranch] [deleteBranch] [createTag] [deleteTag] [status] [log] [push] [pull] [showBranches] [cherryPick] [remoteAdd] [remoteList]

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.git.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.git.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.git.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.git.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.component.git.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.git.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
